page.title: 05KING LUD'S ENTRENCHMENTS.
page.content: Situated at 04860328, the origin of these linear earthworks is unknown; they may date from the Dark Ages and may be the boundary between two kingdoms. Tradition has it that King Lud (who may be King Ludeca of Mercia, or King Lud after whom London's Ludgate is named) is buried under the tumulus known as 'The Tent' which is situated east of the earthworks. The archaeological remains are today part of a Site of Special Scientific Interest, a small part of which near to the Entrenchments being the site of a nature reserve managed by the Leicestershire and Rutland Trust for Nature Conservation.
